Following 5 things must be implemented (ad re-tested at every stage) before AIRport is ready for open alpha deployment (BC ov S):

  1. Block - Blockchain implementation needs to be finished.
  2. Copy Objects - Right now Repositories are interedependent but are not fully autonomous. The final design of Copied records (insert copy, update on load of source Repository) needs to be implemented.
  3. Organizations - Implement Organizations with permissions and repository hierarchy.
  4. Validation - Re-running of Operations based on saved inputs (by the elected owner/server) must be implemented. This probably means a clean root chain and adjustments to the branch chains to get them synced to the root chain (reworking of sync conflict code).
  5. Server implementation - Front+Read server (Rust), Write Queue, Write server (NodeJs), file compaction server (NodeJs), Cross Node OAuth servers (Go) must be implemented. For prompt/affordable start, alpha version can run in AWS (Realional DB, ColumnDB, Queue, Lamda/Kubernetes, S3).

System First


Subsequently following changes will have to be done for Beta (pq sib):

  1. Portable Query rewrite - Proxy based query generation to remove per-app query object creation and greatly reduce App bundles and initialization time
  2. QuckJS Sandboxing - Running Apps in QuickJS, polifylling UI access APIs
  3. Serialization of Block and Schemas to PSON and related work
  4. Internal Schema Preload - load a database file with all initial data.
  5. Block Persist Unsynced to local storage (for later synchronization), in case of tab switch that unloads tab memory (and the data with it).
